member.name: T:SNS.Live.Service.ServerPool
member.summary: The ServerPool encapsulates a collection of memcached servers and the associated SocketPool objects. This class contains the server-selection logic, and contains methods for executing a block of code on a socket from the server corresponding to a given key.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.ServerPool.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Internal constructor. This method takes the array of hosts and sets up an internal list of socketpools.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.ServerPool.GetSocketPool(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Given an item key hash, this method returns the serverpool which is closest on the server key continuum.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.ServerPool.Execute``1(System.UInt32,``0,SNS.Live.Service.UseSocket{``0})
member.summary: This method executes the given delegate on a socket from the server that corresponds to the given hash. If anything causes an error, the given defaultValue will be returned instead. This method takes care of disposing the socket properly once the delegate has executed.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.ServerPool.ExecuteAll(SNS.Live.Service.UseSocket)
member.summary: This method executes the given delegate on all servers.

member.name: T:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient
member.summary: Memcached client main class. Use the static methods Setup and GetInstance to setup and get an instance of the client for use.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Setup(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Static method for creating an instance. This method will throw an exception if the name already exists.
member.param: A list of memcached servers in standard notation: host:port. If port is omitted, the default value of 11211 is used. Both IP addresses and host names are accepted, for example: "localhost", "127.0.0.1", "cache01.example.com:12345", "127.0.0.1:12345", etc.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Exists(System.String)
member.summary: Static method which checks if a given named MemcachedClient instance exists.

member.name: F:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.defaultInstance
member.summary: Static method for getting the default instance named "default".

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.GetInstance(System.String)
member.summary: Static method for getting an instance. This method will first check for named instances that has been set up programmatically. If no such instance exists, it will check the "beitmemcached" section of the standard config file and see if it can find configuration info for it there. If that also fails, an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.hash(System.String)
member.summary: Private key hashing method that uses the modified FNV hash.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.hash(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Private hashing method for user-supplied hash values.
member.param: The user-supplied hash value to hash.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.hash(System.String[])
member.param: An array of keys to hash.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.hash(System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Private multi-hashing method for user-supplied hash values.
member.param: An array of keys to hash.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.checkKey(System.String)
member.summary: Private key-checking method. Throws an exception if the key does not conform to memcached protocol requirements: It may not contain whitespace, it may not be null or empty, and it may not be longer than 250 characters.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Set(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "set" command in the memcached protocol. It will unconditionally set the given key to the given value. Using the overloads it is possible to specify an expiry time, either relative as a TimeSpan or absolute as a DateTime. It is also possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection. This method returns true if the value was successfully set.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Add(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "add" command in the memcached protocol. It will set the given key to the given value only if the key does not already exist. Using the overloads it is possible to specify an expiry time, either relative as a TimeSpan or absolute as a DateTime. It is also possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection. This method returns true if the value was successfully added.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Replace(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "replace" command in the memcached protocol. It will set the given key to the given value only if the key already exists. Using the overloads it is possible to specify an expiry time, either relative as a TimeSpan or absolute as a DateTime. It is also possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection. This method returns true if the value was successfully replaced.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Append(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "append" command in the memcached protocol. It will append the given value to the given key, if the key already exists. Modifying a key with this command will not change its expiry time. Using the overload it is possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Prepend(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "prepend" command in the memcached protocol. It will prepend the given value to the given key, if the key already exists. Modifying a key with this command will not change its expiry time. Using the overload it is possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Get(System.String)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "get" command in the memcached protocol. It will return the value for the given key. It will return null if the key did not exist, or if it was unable to retrieve the value. If given an array of keys, it will return a same-sized array of objects with the corresponding values. Use the overload to specify a custom hash to override server selection.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Gets(System.String,System.UInt64@)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "gets" command in the memcached protocol. It works exactly like the Get method, but it will also return the cas unique value for the item.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Get(System.String[])
member.summary: This method executes a multi-get. It will group the keys by server and execute a single get for each server, and combine the results. The returned object[] will have the same size as the given key array, and contain either null or a value at each position according to the key on that position.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Gets(System.String[],System.UInt64[]@)
member.summary: This method does a multi-gets. It functions exactly like the multi-get method, but it will also return an array of cas unique values as an out parameter.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "delete" command in the memcache protocol. It will immediately delete the given key and corresponding value. Use the overloads to specify an amount of time the item should be in the delete queue on the server, or to specify a custom hash to override server selection.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.SetCounter(System.String,System.UInt64)
member.summary: This method sets the key to the given value, and stores it in a format such that the methods Increment and Decrement can be used successfully on it, i.e. decimal representation of a 64-bit unsigned integer. Using the overloads it is possible to specify an expiry time, either relative as a TimeSpan or absolute as a DateTime. It is also possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection. This method returns true if the counter was successfully set.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.GetCounter(System.String)
member.summary: This method returns the value for the given key as a ulong?, a nullable 64-bit unsigned integer. It returns null if the item did not exist, was not stored properly as per the SetCounter method, or if it was not able to successfully retrieve the item.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Increment(System.String,System.UInt64)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "incr" command in the memcached protocol. It will increase the item with the given value and return the new value. It will return null if the item did not exist, was not stored properly as per the SetCounter method, or if it was not able to successfully retrieve the item.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Decrement(System.String,System.UInt64)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "decr" command in the memcached protocol. It will decrease the item with the given value and return the new value. If the new value would be less than 0, it will be set to 0, and the method will return 0. It will return null if the item did not exist, was not stored properly as per the SetCounter method, or if it was not able to successfully retrieve the item.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.FlushAll
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "flush_all" command in the memcached protocol. When this method is called, it will send the flush command to all servers, thereby deleting all items on all servers. Use the overloads to set a delay for the flushing. If the parameter staggered is set to true, the client will increase the delay for each server, i.e. the first will flush after delay*0, the second after delay*1, the third after delay*2, etc. If set to false, all servers will flush after the same delay. It returns true if the command was successful on all servers.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Stats
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "stats" command in the memcached protocol. It will send the stats command to all servers, and it will return a Dictionary for each server containing the results of the command.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Stats(System.String)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "stats" command in the memcached protocol. It will send the stats command to the server that corresponds to the given key, hash or host, and return a Dictionary containing the results of the command.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.Status
member.summary: This method retrives the status from the serverpool. It checks the connection to all servers and returns usage statistics for each server.

member.name: P:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.KeyPrefix
member.summary: If you specify a key prefix, it will be appended to all keys before they are sent to the memcached server. They key prefix is not used when calculating which server a key belongs to.

member.name: P:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.SendReceiveTimeout
member.summary: The send receive timeout is used to determine how long the client should wait for data to be sent and received from the server, specified in milliseconds. The default value is 2000.

member.name: P:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.MinPoolSize
member.summary: The min pool size determines the number of sockets the socket pool will keep. Note that no sockets will be created on startup, only on use, so the socket pool will only contain this amount of sockets if the amount of simultaneous requests goes above it. The default value is 5.

member.name: P:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.MaxPoolSize
member.summary: The max pool size determines how large the socket connection pool is allowed to grow. There can be more sockets in use than this amount, but when the extra sockets are returned, they will be destroyed. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.SocketRecycleAge
member.summary: If the pool contains more than the minimum amount of sockets, and a socket is returned that is older than this recycle age that socket will be destroyed instead of put back in the pool. This allows the pool to shrink back to the min pool size after a peak in usage. The default value is 30 minutes.

member.name: P:SNS.Live.Service.MemcachedClient.CompressionThreshold
member.summary: If an object being stored is larger in bytes than the compression threshold, it will internally be compressed before begin stored, and it will transparently be decompressed when retrieved. Only strings, byte arrays and objects can be compressed. The default value is 1048576 bytes = 1MB.

member.name: T:SNS.Live.Service.SocketPool
member.summary: The SocketPool encapsulates the list of PooledSockets against one specific host, and contains methods for acquiring or returning PooledSockets.

member.name: F:SNS.Live.Service.SocketPool.deadEndPointSecondsUntilRetry
member.summary: If the host stops responding, we mark it as dead for this amount of seconds, and we double this for each consecutive failed retry. If the host comes alive again, we reset this to 1 again.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.SocketPool.getEndPoint(System.String)
member.summary: This method parses the given string into an IPEndPoint. If the string is malformed in some way, or if the host cannot be resolved, this method will throw an exception.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.SocketPool.Acquire
member.summary: Gets a socket from the pool. If there are no free sockets, a new one will be created. If something goes wrong while creating the new socket, this pool's endpoint will be marked as dead and all subsequent calls to this method will return null until the retry interval has passed.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.SocketPool.Return(SNS.Live.Service.PooledSocket)
member.summary: Returns a socket to the pool. If the socket is dead, it will be destroyed. If there are more than MaxPoolSize sockets in the pool, it will be destroyed. If there are less than MinPoolSize sockets in the pool, it will always be put back. If there are something inbetween those values, the age of the socket is checked. If it is older than the SocketRrecycleAge, it is destroyed, otherwise it will be put back in the pool.

member.name: T:SNS.Live.Service.PooledSocket
member.summary: The PooledSocket class encapsulates a socket connection to a specified memcached server. It contains a buffered stream for communication, and methods for sending and retrieving data from the memcached server, as well as general memcached error checking.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.PooledSocket.Dispose
member.summary: Disposing of a PooledSocket object in any way causes it to be returned to its SocketPool.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.PooledSocket.Close
member.summary: This method closes the underlying stream and socket.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.PooledSocket.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a string to the socket encoded in UTF8 format.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.PooledSocket.Write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes an array of bytes to the socket and flushes the stream.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.PooledSocket.ReadLine
member.summary: Reads from the socket until the sequence '\r\n' is encountered, and returns everything up to but not including that sequence as a UTF8-encoded string

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.PooledSocket.ReadResponse
member.summary: Reads a response line from the socket, checks for general memcached errors, and returns the line. If an error is encountered, this method will throw an exception.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.PooledSocket.Read(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Fills the given byte array with data from the socket.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.PooledSocket.SkipUntilEndOfLine
member.summary: Reads from the socket until the sequence '\r\n' is encountered.

member.name: M:SNS.Live.Service.PooledSocket.Reset
member.summary: Resets this PooledSocket by making sure the incoming buffer of the socket is empty. If there was any leftover data, this method return true.

member.name: P:SNS.Live.Service.PooledSocket.IsAlive
member.summary: Checks if the underlying socket and stream is connected and available.
